abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Energy Transit
            Institution Building (ETIB) Project for Georgia were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was moderate, Bank performance was satisfactory, and
            Borrower performance was moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned included: the ETIB Credit had multiple
            beneficiaries with little experience of joint
            decision-making and some sense of distrust, which made
            consensus difficult. Creating a steering committee,
            comprising highest-level officials was a novel concept that
            aimed to improve consensus building and a sense of ownership
            among Credit beneficiaries. However, this arrangement proved
            to be operationally impractical for several reasons.
            Therefore, the operational aspect of the Credit should be
            separated from the Steering Committee (SC), or SC
            decision-making should be delegated to less senior public
            officials. Negotiation advisor assistance requires strong
            levels of trust among Bank and beneficiary stakeholders, and
            less stringent monitoring of the content of the
            negotiations. Since the negotiation advisors are
            'insiders' from the industry under negotiation and
            well connected to both sides of the negotiations this can
            lead to a perception of corruption. The Bank responds to the
            perceived corruption by increased scrutiny, which may erode
            project effectiveness and damage outcomes. A key aim of the
            project was to build and sustain institutional capacity. The
            monitoring unit in the ministry of environment was an
            effective institutional setup that succeeded in
            consolidating staff and institutional experience during
            project implementation. In addition, funding equipment and
            operational costs from the Credit strengthened unit
            effectiveness, and post-project unit operation appears sustainable.
